intro: Rhynchospermum taquetii, commonly known as the Taquet's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Rhynchospermum taquetii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
